posts.raw_content:
Dear Family,I've been reflecting deeply and praying about two pressing matters, and I feel compelled to share my thoughts with you.

 ***Healing Our Nation:*** Our country is deeply divided by politics, where each side clings to its own perspective and dismisses the other. How can we begin to heal this rift? What steps can bring us together?

 ***President Trump’s Faith:*** Recently, Donald Trump expressed uncertainty about his salvation, which struck me as surprising for a man surrounded by faith-driven individuals and admired by many for his leadership. It prompted me to reflect on how we can respond.

In prayer, the Lord placed a powerful idea on my heart: we are called to pray for our leaders, the lost, and even our enemies. Prayer has the potential to unite us. Despite differing views on Trump—whether seen as un-Christian by some or assumed to be saved by others—his own words reveal a personal struggle with faith. This vulnerability offers a unique opportunity for us to come together as Americans in humble prayer, seeking a deeper relationship with Jesus Christ for him and for all.Healing cannot thrive in a "Left vs. Right" divide. It requires a foundation of truth, prayer, and love. Instead of focusing on political victories or the "Great Awakening," what if we centered our efforts on our shared need for a Savior, Jesus Christ?

 >1 Timothy 2:1-2 – "I urge, then, first of all, that petitions, prayers, intercession and thanksgiving be made for all people—for kings and all those in authority, that we may live peaceful and quiet lives in all godliness and holiness."

 Prayer is a transformative force that many Christians underutilize. While we pray throughout the day, giving thanks and seeking Jesus, do we truly yearn for prayer? Do we seek Him above all else? Imagine if we set aside our pride, our "I'm right, you're wrong" mindset, and united in prayer for the man at the heart of our nation's political divide. Love him or hate him, President Trump needs our prayers.I invite you to join me in a daily commitment to pray for President Trump, that he may deepen his relationship with our Creator and find unshakable confidence in His salvation. Let’s pray that the Holy Spirit moves in his heart, inspiring him to bring God’s love and truth to our nation.

 ***Join us daily for one minute of prayer at 2:00 PM and 8:00 PM Eastern.***

I’m seeking your feedback and guidance as I pray for ways to share this message widely. Let’s unite in this cause, trusting the Lord to lead us.In Christ’s love,
Love you all.

 ***Together through Christ we have endless potential***


u/#prayer

I need your help Spreading the Message though. If you feel led we could use the whole team on this one!! GOD WINS

 >Jonah 3:6-10

>The People of Nineveh Repent

 >6 The word reached[a] the king of Nineveh, and he arose from his throne, removed his robe, covered himself with sackcloth, and sat in ashes. 7 And he issued a proclamation and published through Nineveh, “By the decree of the king and his nobles: Let neither man nor beast, herd nor flock, taste anything. Let them not feed or drink water, 8 but let man and beast be covered with sackcloth, and let them call out mightily to God. Let everyone turn from his evil way and from the violence that is in his hands. 9 Who knows? God may turn and relent and turn from his fierce anger, so that we may not perish.”

 >10 When God saw what they did, how they turned from their evil way, God relented of the disaster that he had said he would do to them, and he did not do it.

posts.content:
Dear Family,I've been reflecting deeply and praying about two pressing matters, and I feel compelled to share my thoughts with you.

Healing Our Nation: Our country is deeply divided by politics, where each side clings to its own perspective and dismisses the other. How can we begin to heal this rift? What steps can bring us together?

President Trump’s Faith: Recently, Donald Trump expressed uncertainty about his salvation, which struck me as surprising for a man surrounded by faith-driven individuals and admired by many for his leadership. It prompted me to reflect on how we can respond.

In prayer, the Lord placed a powerful idea on my heart: we are called to pray for our leaders, the lost, and even our enemies. Prayer has the potential to unite us. Despite differing views on Trump—whether seen as un-Christian by some or assumed to be saved by others—his own words reveal a personal struggle with faith. This vulnerability offers a unique opportunity for us to come together as Americans in humble prayer, seeking a deeper relationship with Jesus Christ for him and for all.Healing cannot thrive in a "Left vs. Right" divide. It requires a foundation of truth, prayer, and love. Instead of focusing on political victories or the "Great Awakening," what if we centered our efforts on our shared need for a Savior, Jesus Christ?

1 Timothy 2:1-2 – "I urge, then, first of all, that petitions, prayers, intercession and thanksgiving be made for all people—for kings and all those in authority, that we may live peaceful and quiet lives in all godliness and holiness."

Prayer is a transformative force that many Christians underutilize. While we pray throughout the day, giving thanks and seeking Jesus, do we truly yearn for prayer? Do we seek Him above all else? Imagine if we set aside our pride, our "I'm right, you're wrong" mindset, and united in prayer for the man at the heart of our nation's political divide. Love him or hate him, President Trump needs our prayers.I invite you to join me in a daily commitment to pray for President Trump, that he may deepen his relationship with our Creator and find unshakable confidence in His salvation. Let’s pray that the Holy Spirit moves in his heart, inspiring him to bring God’s love and truth to our nation.

Join us daily for one minute of prayer at 2:00 PM and 8:00 PM Eastern.

I’m seeking your feedback and guidance as I pray for ways to share this message widely. Let’s unite in this cause, trusting the Lord to lead us.In Christ’s love, Love you all.

Together through Christ we have endless potential

u/#prayer

I need your help Spreading the Message though. If you feel led we could use the whole team on this one!! GOD WINS

Jonah 3:6-10

The People of Nineveh Repent

6 The word reached[a] the king of Nineveh, and he arose from his throne, removed his robe, covered himself with sackcloth, and sat in ashes. 7 And he issued a proclamation and published through Nineveh, “By the decree of the king and his nobles: Let neither man nor beast, herd nor flock, taste anything. Let them not feed or drink water, 8 but let man and beast be covered with sackcloth, and let them call out mightily to God. Let everyone turn from his evil way and from the violence that is in his hands. 9 Who knows? God may turn and relent and turn from his fierce anger, so that we may not perish.”

10 When God saw what they did, how they turned from their evil way, God relented of the disaster that he had said he would do to them, and he did not do it.
